com.jayway.restassured.authentication

Class CertificateAuthSettings

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jayway.restassured.authentication.CertificateAuthSettings

  • public class CertificateAuthSettings
extends Object
    A specification for more advanced usages of certificate authentication. Example usage: 
     given().auth().certificate("keystore.jks", "my_password", certAuthSettings().allowAllHostNames());

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CertificateAuthSettings()
      Create a new instance of the Certificate Authentication Options with the default settings of: keystoreType = KeyStore.getDefaultType() port = 443 trustStore = null x509HostnameVerifier = SSLSocketFactory.STRICT_HOSTNAME_VERIFIER SSLSocketFactory = null

    • Constructor Detail

      • CertificateAuthSettings

        public CertificateAuthSettings()
        Create a new instance of the Certificate Authentication Options with the default settings of:
        • keystoreType = KeyStore.getDefaultType()
        • port = 443
        • trustStore = null
        • x509HostnameVerifier = SSLSocketFactory.STRICT_HOSTNAME_VERIFIER
        • SSLSocketFactory = null
        See Also:
        certAuthSettings()

    • Method Detail

        public org.apache.http.conn.ssl.SSLSocketFactory getSSLSocketFactory()

      • strictHostnames

        public CertificateAuthSettings strictHostnames()
        Configure the CertificateAuthSettings to use strict host name verification (this is the default behavior).
        Returns:
        A new CertificateAuthSettings instance
        See Also:
        SSLSocketFactory.STRICT_HOSTNAME_VERIFIER

      • allowAllHostnames

        public CertificateAuthSettings allowAllHostnames()
        Configure the CertificateAuthSettings to allow all host names.
        Returns:
        A new CertificateAuthSettings instance
        See Also:
        SSLSocketFactory.ALLOW_ALL_HOSTNAME_VERIFIER

      • x509HostnameVerifier

        public CertificateAuthSettings x509HostnameVerifier(org.apache.http.conn.ssl.X509HostnameVerifier x509HostnameVerifier)
        Configure the CertificateAuthSettings to use the provided X509HostnameVerifier instance.
        Returns:
        A new CertificateAuthSettings instance
        See Also:
        SSLSocketFactory.ALLOW_ALL_HOSTNAME_VERIFIER, allowAllHostnames()

      • getX509HostnameVerifier

        public org.apache.http.conn.ssl.X509HostnameVerifier getX509HostnameVerifier()
        Returns:
        The configured X509HostnameVerifier

      • keystoreType

        public CertificateAuthSettings keystoreType(String keystoreType)
        Parameters:
        keystoreType - The keystore type, by default KeyStore.getDefaultType().
        Returns:
        A new instance of CertificateAuthSettings with the updated setting.

      • port

        public CertificateAuthSettings port(int port)
        Parameters:
        port - The port, by default 443.
        Returns:
        A new instance of CertificateAuthSettings with the updated setting.

      • trustStore

        public CertificateAuthSettings trustStore(KeyStore trustStore)
        Parameters:
        trustStore - The trust store to use, by default no (null) trust store is used.
        Returns:
        A new instance of CertificateAuthSettings with the updated setting.

        Parameters:

      • certAuthSettings

        public static CertificateAuthSettings certAuthSettings()
        Create a new instance of CertificateAuthSettings with default values. Same as called CertificateAuthSettings() but a bit more "fluent".
        Returns:
        a new instance of CertificateAuthSettings with default values.
